title: NewsBreak: Sterling Falls as Court Rules Parliament Suspension Legal
text:
NewsBreak: Sterling Falls as Court Rules Parliament Suspension Legal

Forex 2 hours ago (Sep 06, 2019 11:40)

© Reuters. Investing.com - The pound tumbled in early morning trading Friday after the high court in London ruled that U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s move to suspend parliament was legal. The ruling will be appealed to the supreme court, which has already agreed to hear appeals on Sept. 17. fell 0.3% to 1.2297 as of 5:27 AM ET (9:27 GMT). rose 0.3% to 0.8969. The yield fell 0.033 to 0.566%.

NewsBreak: Sterling Falls as Court Rules Parliament Suspension Legal
description: NewsBreak: Sterling Falls as Court Rules Parliament Suspension Legal
